title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0140

segments.en: Hello, English learners.
segments.cn: 你好，英语学习者。

segments.en: Welcome back to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 欢迎回到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: And my name is Catherine.
segments.cn: 我叫Catherine。

segments.en: So what are we talking about today, Marco?
segments.cn: 那么，Marco，今天我们要谈什么？

segments.en: Well, we're talking about one of my favorite topics which are computers.
segments.cn: 嗯，我们要谈我最喜欢的话题之一——计算机。

segments.en: Yes, you're a little bit of a nerd.
segments.cn: 是的，你有点书呆子气。

segments.en: A little bit.
segments.cn: 有点。

segments.en: I love computers and technology and everything that's related to it.
segments.cn: 我喜欢计算机和技术，以及与之相关的一切。

segments.en: So that's what we're going to be looking at today.
segments.cn: 所以这就是我们今天要讨论的内容。

segments.en: Maybe we're buying a new computer.
segments.cn: 也许我们要买一台新电脑。

segments.en: Well, I anticipate learning something from this because there are a lot of those fancy big words that I don't know that have to do with processors and things.
segments.cn: 嗯，我期待从中学到一些东西，因为有很多我不知道的复杂术语与处理器等有关。

segments.en: So that's going to be coming up in a minute here.
segments.cn: 所以这将在这里马上出现。

segments.en: But first, let's just jump right in and take a listen to today's dialogue.
segments.cn: 但首先，让我们直接进入，听听今天的对话。

segments.en: So can you fix it?
segments.cn: 那你能修好吗？

segments.en: I'm sorry, sir.
segments.cn: 对不起，先生。

segments.en: This computer is not broken or damaged.
segments.cn: 这台电脑没有坏或损坏。

segments.en: It's simply just too old.
segments.cn: 它只是太旧了。

segments.en: That's why your programs and applications are running slow.
segments.cn: 这就是为什么你的程序和应用运行缓慢。

segments.en: There really isn't much I can do.
segments.cn: 我真的无能为力。

segments.en: What do you mean?
segments.cn: 你是什么意思？

segments.en: I bought this computer just three years ago.
segments.cn: 我三年前才买的这台电脑。

segments.en: Yes, but technology is ever-changing and technology is becoming obsolete faster and faster.
segments.cn: 是的，但技术在不断变化，技术变得过时的速度越来越快。

segments.en: Okay, I know where this is going.
segments.cn: 好吧，我知道这会怎样。

segments.en: How much will it cost me to get a new computer?
segments.cn: 买一台新电脑要花多少钱？

segments.en: Well, this desktop over here is our latest model.
segments.cn: 嗯，这台桌面电脑是我们最新的型号。

segments.en: It has a 4 gigahertz processor with 16 gigabytes in RAM and a hard disk with 1 terabyte.
segments.cn: 它有一个4千兆赫的处理器，16GB的RAM和1TB的硬盘。

segments.en: Of course, it includes a mouse, keyboard, and desk speakers.
segments.cn: 当然，它包括鼠标、键盘和桌面音箱。

segments.en: I have no idea what you are talking about.
segments.cn: 我完全不知道你在说什么。

segments.en: I just want to know if it's good, and if I'll be able to play solitaire without the computer crashing or freezing all the time.
segments.cn: 我只想知道它是否好，以及我是否能在不崩溃或冻结的情况下玩接龙。

segments.en: This PC is top of the line, and I guarantee it will never freeze.
segments.cn: 这台电脑是顶级的，我保证它永远不会冻结。

segments.en: If it does, we'll give you your money back.
segments.cn: 如果它冻结，我们会退还你的钱。

segments.en: Alright, we're back.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们回来了。

segments.en: I think it's a very typical case.
segments.cn: 我觉得这是一个非常典型的案例。

segments.en: You go in to get something fixed, and they say, we can't fix it.
segments.cn: 你去修东西，他们说，我们不能修。

segments.en: You need a new one.
segments.cn: 你需要一个新的。

segments.en: Yes, and not only a new one, but a bigger and better and faster one.
segments.cn: 是的，不仅需要一个新的，还需要一个更大、更好、更快的。

segments.en: And more expensive, obviously.
segments.cn: 而且显然更贵。

segments.en: It's called the upsell.
segments.cn: 这叫做推销。

segments.en: The upsell, yeah.
segments.cn: 推销，是的。

segments.en: Alright, so there were some very difficult words, I think, because they're very specific related to technology and computers.
segments.cn: 好吧，我认为有一些非常困难的词，因为它们与技术和计算机非常相关。

segments.en: So, why don't we look at those now in Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 那么，为什么我们不现在在语言收获中看看这些呢？

segments.en: Alright, so the first word we have today is when something is no longer in use.
segments.cn: 好吧，今天我们第一个词是指某物不再使用。

segments.en: Okay, so this word is obsolete.
segments.cn: 好吧，这个词是过时的。

segments.en: It's obsolete.
segments.cn: 它是过时的。

segments.en: Obsolete.
segments.cn: 过时。

segments.en: And we're not just talking about like, oh, I haven't touched that pen in like 10 years.
segments.cn: 我们不仅仅是在说，哦，我已经10年没碰过那支笔了。

segments.en: We're talking about a piece of technology that is no longer useful because there's something else that can do a better job.
segments.cn: 我们在谈论一项技术，因为有其他东西可以做得更好。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: And actually, not only with technology, we also have words that are obsolete, right?
segments.cn: 实际上，不仅仅是技术，我们也有过时的词，对吧？

segments.en: Exactly, like thy or thine.
segments.cn: 正是如此，比如thy或thine。

segments.en: You or yours.
segments.cn: 你或你的。

segments.en: Classical English.
segments.cn: 古典英语。

segments.en: We don't use thy anymore.
segments.cn: 我们不再使用thy了。

segments.en: No.
segments.cn: 不。

segments.en: But... Thou art very summery today, Marco.
segments.cn: 但是……你今天看起来很夏天，Marco。

segments.en: We don't use that anymore.
segments.cn: 我们不再使用那种说法了。

segments.en: That's obsolete English, right?
segments.cn: 那是过时的英语，对吧？

segments.en: Or obsolete words.
segments.cn: 或者过时的词。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So obsolete means it's no longer of use.
segments.cn: 所以过时意味着它不再有用。

segments.en: We have better and newer things in its place.
segments.cn: 我们有更好更新的东西取而代之。

segments.en: Alright.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: And now moving on, when the salesman was describing the characteristics of the computer, he used some prefixes that were a little bit strange, right?
segments.cn: 现在继续，当销售员描述计算机的特性时，他使用了一些有点奇怪的前缀，对吧？

segments.en: Like, for example, giga.
segments.cn: 比如说，千兆。

segments.en: Giga what?
segments.cn: 千兆什么？

segments.en: Giga.
segments.cn: 千兆。

segments.en: Alright, so these are actually prefixes that have to do with numbers.
segments.cn: 好吧，这些实际上是与数字有关的前缀。

segments.en: And so this is not just a computer thing, this is a math thing or a science thing.
segments.cn: 所以这不仅仅是计算机的事情，这是数学或科学的事情。

segments.en: Okay, so we've got three different prefixes.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们有三个不同的前缀。

segments.en: A prefix is something we tack on at the beginning of a word.
segments.cn: 前缀是我们加在单词开头的东西。

segments.en: So we have hertz or byte, right?
segments.cn: 所以我们有赫兹或字节，对吧？

segments.en: These are little bits of a computer, byte.
segments.cn: 这些是计算机的小单位，字节。

segments.en: Right, so you have like megabytes.
segments.cn: 对，所以你有像兆字节这样的东西。

segments.en: Megabytes we've all heard before.
segments.cn: 兆字节我们都听说过。

segments.en: That's the smallest here.
segments.cn: 这是最小的。

segments.en: We've got megabytes, but bigger than mega, we've got gigabytes.
segments.cn: 我们有兆字节，但比兆更大的，我们有千兆字节。

segments.en: A giga... Yeah, so now, for example, the hard drives are 250 gigabytes.
segments.cn: 千兆……是的，例如，硬盘是250千兆字节。

segments.en: You might even hear someone say gigs.
segments.cn: 你甚至可能听到有人说“千兆”。

segments.en: You've got a 250 gig hard drive.
segments.cn: 你有一个250千兆的硬盘。

segments.en: But what's bigger than giga?
segments.cn: 但比千兆更大的是什么？

segments.en: Now it's the terabyte.
segments.cn: 现在是太字节。

segments.en: Ooh, tera, it sounds like... huge.
segments.cn: 哦，太，听起来像……巨大。

segments.en: Yeah, I actually wondered what would happen after gigabyte, because it's so much information already, and now it's the terabyte.
segments.cn: 是的，我实际上想知道在千兆字节之后会发生什么，因为信息已经很多了，现在是太字节。

segments.en: So it's like 1000 gigabytes.
segments.cn: 所以是1000千兆字节。

segments.en: So that's like 200 movies.
segments.cn: 所以大约是200部电影。

segments.en: That's probably more than that.
segments.cn: 可能比那还多。

segments.en: It's amazing the amount of storage you can have and how small it actually is.
segments.cn: 你可以拥有的存储量和它实际上有多小，真是令人惊讶。

segments.en: So mega, giga, tera, going from littlest to biggest.
segments.cn: 所以兆、千兆、太，从最小到最大。

segments.en: Alright.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: And, well, he described a 4 GHz processor.
segments.cn: 而且，他描述了一个4 GHz的处理器。

segments.en: Okay, so the processor is our next word and this is actually something that determines how fast your computer is going to run.
segments.cn: 好吧，处理器是我们的下一个词，这实际上决定了你的计算机运行的速度。

segments.en: So it comes from the word to process, right?
segments.cn: 所以它来自“处理”这个词，对吧？

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: To like calculate or to think.
segments.cn: 就是计算或思考。

segments.en: Do, even.
segments.cn: 甚至是做。

segments.en: To do.
segments.cn: 去做。

segments.en: So you have different examples like a word processor.
segments.cn: 所以你有不同的例子，比如文字处理器。

segments.en: Right, so it's like Microsoft Word.
segments.cn: 对，所以它就像Microsoft Word。

segments.en: It allows you to make word documents.
segments.cn: 它允许你制作文档。

segments.en: You can also say to process data.
segments.cn: 你也可以说处理数据。

segments.en: You're trying to calculate it.
segments.cn: 你在尝试计算它。

segments.en: But in this case, a processor is like a little brain that's the center of the computer and that's where all the information gets processed.
segments.cn: 但在这种情况下，处理器就像是计算机的一个小脑袋，是所有信息处理的中心。

segments.en: Yeah, so it's the brain of the computer essentially.
segments.cn: 是的，所以它本质上是计算机的大脑。

segments.en: And the bigger it is, the faster it can go.
segments.cn: 而且它越大，速度就越快。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: And well, if you don't have a very good processor, your computer is bound to freeze.
segments.cn: 如果你没有一个很好的处理器，你的计算机肯定会卡住。

segments.en: Okay, so freezing is another keyword, especially when talking about computers.
segments.cn: 好的，所以卡住是另一个关键词，特别是在谈论计算机时。

segments.en: This one drives me nuts.
segments.cn: 这个让我抓狂。

segments.en: To freeze it means to stop moving.
segments.cn: 卡住意味着停止移动。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: Right, so well it has a couple different meanings.
segments.cn: 对，所以它有几种不同的含义。

segments.en: You might have heard it about ice before, but to freeze here we're talking about stopping moving.
segments.cn: 你可能以前听说过冰，但在这里我们说的卡住是指停止移动。

segments.en: So we have a game called freeze tag where if I touch you, you have to stop running.
segments.cn: 所以我们有一个叫做“冰冻标签”的游戏，如果我碰到你，你就必须停止跑。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: But here we're talking about a computer freezing.
segments.cn: 但这里我们说的是计算机卡住。

segments.en: I'm moving my mouse and I'm typing and all of a sudden... It doesn't work anymore.
segments.cn: 我在移动鼠标，打字，突然……它不再工作了。

segments.en: My mouse doesn't move.
segments.cn: 我的鼠标不动了。

segments.en: I can't close or open or do anything and it's really frustrating.
segments.cn: 我无法关闭、打开或做任何事情，这真的很让人沮丧。

segments.en: Especially if you're doing something and you didn't save your work, it's gone.
segments.cn: 尤其是当你在做某事而没有保存工作时，它就消失了。

segments.en: Right, so if your computer freezes then usually you have to restart it or turn it off or not.
segments.cn: 对，所以如果你的计算机卡住，通常你必须重启它或关掉它。

segments.en: So that is about it for those words, but let's take another listen and slow the dialogue down this time so you can catch some of those big words.
segments.cn: 所以这些词就到此为止，但让我们再听一遍，这次慢一点对话，这样你可以抓住一些大词。

segments.en: Just too old.
segments.cn: 只是太旧了。

segments.en: That's why your programs and applications are running slow.
segments.cn: 这就是为什么你的程序和应用运行缓慢。

segments.en: There really isn't much I can do.
segments.cn: 我真的无能为力。

segments.en: What do you mean?
segments.cn: 你是什么意思？

segments.en: I bought this computer just three years ago.
segments.cn: 我三年前买的这台电脑。

segments.en: Yes, but technology is ever changing and technology is becoming obsolete faster and faster.
segments.cn: 是的，但技术在不断变化，技术变得过时的速度越来越快。

segments.en: Okay, I know where this is going.
segments.cn: 好吧，我知道这会怎样。

segments.en: How much will it cost me to get a new computer?
segments.cn: 买一台新电脑要花多少钱？

segments.en: Well, this desktop over here is our latest model.
segments.cn: 嗯，这台桌面电脑是我们最新的型号。

segments.en: It has a 4 gigahertz processor with 16 gigabytes in RAM and a hard disk with 1 terabyte.
segments.cn: 它有一个4千兆赫的处理器，16GB的RAM和1TB的硬盘。

segments.en: Of course, it includes a mouse, keyboard and desk speakers.
segments.cn: 当然，它包括鼠标、键盘和桌面音箱。

segments.en: I have no idea what you are talking about.
segments.cn: 我不知道你在说什么。

segments.en: I just want to know if it's good and if I'll be able to play solitaire without the computer crashing or freezing all the time.
segments.cn: 我只想知道它是否好，以及我是否能在不崩溃或卡住的情况下玩接龙。

segments.en: This PC is top of the line and I guarantee it will never freeze.
segments.cn: 这台电脑是顶级的，我保证它永远不会卡住。

segments.en: If it does, we'll give you your money back.
segments.cn: 如果它卡住，我们会退还你的钱。

segments.en: Great, so we are back.
segments.cn: 太好了，我们回来了。

segments.en: So now let's jump into today's Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 现在让我们进入今天的流利构建器。

segments.en: Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 流利构建器。

segments.en: Alright, so on Fluency Builder we are going to take a look at three different phrases.
segments.cn: 好吧，在流利构建器中，我们将看三个不同的短语。

segments.en: For example, the salesman was describing technology and said that it's ever changing.
segments.cn: 例如，销售员在描述技术时说它在不断变化。

segments.en: Okay, so this is a sort of poetic line here.
segments.cn: 好吧，这是一种诗意的表达。

segments.en: Ever changing means always changing.
segments.cn: 不断变化意味着总是在变化。

segments.en: Always.
segments.cn: 总是。

segments.en: Always changing.
segments.cn: 总是在变化。

segments.en: And so we can say that the ocean is ever changing.
segments.cn: 所以我们可以说海洋在不断变化。

segments.en: You know, the waves are always changing.
segments.cn: 你知道，海浪总是在变化。

segments.en: But in this case he's saying that technology is always changing.
segments.cn: 但在这种情况下，他说技术总是在变化。

segments.en: It's always progressing into something new.
segments.cn: 它总是在进步，变成新的东西。

segments.en: And so that is a key selling point for this guy.
segments.cn: 所以这是这个家伙的一个关键卖点。

segments.en: Right, so this is actually a very interesting word.
segments.cn: 对，所以这实际上是一个非常有趣的词。

segments.en: We can use it like in your example beyond technology, like the way the sea is ever changing.
segments.cn: 我们可以在你的例子中使用它，超越技术，比如海洋在不断变化的方式。

segments.en: So why don't we There's always something new in this ever changing world.
segments.cn: 所以为什么我们不说在这个不断变化的世界中总有新的东西。

segments.en: The flu is an ever changing virus that continues to claim many lives.
segments.cn: 流感是一种不断变化的病毒，继续夺走许多生命。

segments.en: Alright, we're back so now we understand the ever changing.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们回来了，所以现在我们理解了不断变化。

segments.en: So the man who's trying to buy this computer or at least get his computer fixed really starts to get frustrated with the salesman and he says, okay I know where this is going.
segments.cn: 所以那个试图买这台电脑的人，或者至少想修好他的电脑，真的开始对销售员感到沮丧，他说，好吧，我知道这会怎样。

segments.en: So he hears the sales pitch.
segments.cn: 所以他听到了销售推销。

segments.en: He hears this guy trying to loosen him up a little bit.
segments.cn: 他听到这个家伙试图让他放松一点。

segments.en: He says, I know where this is going.
segments.cn: 他说，我知道这会怎样。

segments.en: So what does this mean?
segments.cn: 那这是什么意思？

segments.en: Where something is going.
segments.cn: 某事的发展方向。

segments.en: So basically what direction a conversation or a topic or a situation is taking.
segments.cn: 所以基本上是谈话、话题或情况的方向。

segments.en: Okay, so he's saying, I know why you're telling me these things.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以他说，我知道你为什么告诉我这些事情。

segments.en: I know your motive.
segments.cn: 我知道你的动机。

segments.en: Or I know what's happening.
segments.cn: 或者我知道发生了什么。

segments.en: I know what you're going to say.
segments.cn: 我知道你要说什么。

segments.en: Okay, so he's essentially saying, I know you're going to try and sell me a computer.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以他本质上在说，我知道你会试图卖给我一台电脑。

segments.en: So you can use it in other circumstances.
segments.cn: 所以你可以在其他情况下使用它。

segments.en: For example, a relationship.
segments.cn: 例如，在一段关系中。

segments.en: I don't know where this is going.
segments.cn: 我不知道这会怎样。

segments.en: Right, what is going?
segments.cn: 对，发生了什么？

segments.en: Classic breakup line.
segments.cn: 经典的分手台词。

segments.en: I just don't think I know where this is going anymore.
segments.cn: 我只是觉得我不知道这会怎样了。

segments.en: So in reference to the relationship right?
segments.cn: 所以在谈到关系时，对吧？

segments.en: We don't know what's happening.
segments.cn: 我们不知道发生了什么。

segments.en: Are we serious?
segments.cn: 我们认真吗？

segments.en: Are we maybe going to get married?
segments.cn: 我们可能会结婚吗？

segments.en: I don't know anymore.
segments.cn: 我不知道了。

segments.en: I can't tell where this movie is going.
segments.cn: 我无法判断这部电影会怎样。

segments.en: It's so like here and there and boring.
segments.cn: 它是如此的无聊和无趣。

segments.en: You don't know the plot.
segments.cn: 你不知道情节。

segments.en: Alright, so it's a very common phrase and it sounds very natural when you say it right?
segments.cn: 好吧，所以这是一个非常常见的短语，当你说它时听起来非常自然，对吧？

segments.en: It does and that's why it's in Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 确实如此，这就是为什么它在流利构建器中。

segments.en: It really helps you sound like a more native English speaker when you use these kind of phrases.
segments.cn: 当你使用这些短语时，它确实帮助你听起来更像一个本地英语使用者。

segments.en: And the next one is also very very good when he describes the condition of the computer.
segments.cn: 下一个也是非常好的，当他描述计算机的状况时。

segments.en: He says it's top of the line.
segments.cn: 他说它是顶级的。

segments.en: Top of the line.
segments.cn: 顶级的。

segments.en: Now what line we're talking about I do not know.
segments.cn: 我不知道我们在谈论什么样的线。

segments.en: Like above average line.
segments.cn: 就是超出平均水平的线。

segments.en: Right, so this is the best of the best.
segments.cn: 对，所以这是最好的。

segments.en: This is the top model or the top computer.
segments.cn: 这是顶级型号或顶级计算机。

segments.en: And you can definitely imagine a car salesman using this.
segments.cn: 你绝对可以想象一个汽车销售员使用这个。

segments.en: Yes, this BMW is top of the line.
segments.cn: 是的，这辆宝马是顶级的。

segments.en: It's the best money can buy.
segments.cn: 这是钱能买到的最好。

segments.en: Yeah, that's another good one.
segments.cn: 是的，那也是一个不错的选择。

segments.en: So basically top of the line is the best of the best.
segments.cn: 所以基本上，顶级就是最好的。

segments.en: Above average, right?
segments.cn: 超过平均水平，对吧？

segments.en: More than above average.
segments.cn: 超过平均水平。

segments.en: It's really it's the best you can do.
segments.cn: 真的，这是你能做到的最好。

segments.en: And so the guy is saying listen this is our best computer.
segments.cn: 所以那个人说，听着，这是我们最好的电脑。

segments.en: Really you should buy it.
segments.cn: 真的，你应该买它。

segments.en: And obviously top of the line usually costs a lot of money.
segments.cn: 显然，顶级通常要花很多钱。

segments.en: Yeah, it's usually for something that costs money, right?
segments.cn: 是的，通常是花钱的东西，对吧？

segments.en: For things.
segments.cn: 对于物品。

segments.en: You wouldn't really use it for a person, right?
segments.cn: 你不会真的用它来形容一个人，对吧？

segments.en: He's top of the line.
segments.cn: 他是顶级的。

segments.en: Top of the line I think generally refers to electronics and cars or like motorcycles.
segments.cn: 顶级通常指电子产品和汽车或摩托车。

segments.en: And so you often hear top of the line stereo, top of the line TV, top of the line car.
segments.cn: 所以你经常听到顶级音响、顶级电视、顶级汽车。

segments.en: But you wouldn't say this about food or people or art.
segments.cn: 但你不会这样说食物、人物或艺术。

segments.en: Yeah, you wouldn't say this painting is top of the line.
segments.cn: 是的，你不会说这幅画是顶级的。

segments.en: No, not about like very unique things.
segments.cn: 不，不是关于非常独特的东西。

segments.en: You'd say this about kind of manufactured things.
segments.cn: 你会说这关于某种制造的东西。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: So we've taken a look at a lot of great phrases.
segments.cn: 所以我们看了很多很好的短语。

segments.en: Why don't we listen to our dialogue for the last time and then we'll come back.
segments.cn: 为什么我们不最后听一次对话，然后再回来。

segments.en: So can you fix it?
segments.cn: 那你能修好吗？

segments.en: I'm sorry, sir.
segments.cn: 对不起，先生。

segments.en: This computer is not broken or damaged.
segments.cn: 这台电脑没有坏或损坏。

segments.en: It's simply just too old.
segments.cn: 它只是太旧了。

segments.en: That's why your programs and applications are running slow.
segments.cn: 这就是为什么你的程序和应用运行缓慢。

segments.en: There really isn't much I can do.
segments.cn: 我真的无能为力。

segments.en: What do you mean?
segments.cn: 你是什么意思？

segments.en: I bought this computer just three years ago.
segments.cn: 我三年前才买的这台电脑。

segments.en: Yes, but technology is ever changing and technology is becoming obsolete faster and faster.
segments.cn: 是的，但技术在不断变化，技术变得过时的速度越来越快。

segments.en: Okay, I know where this is going.
segments.cn: 好吧，我知道这要去哪里。

segments.en: How much will it cost me to get a new computer?
segments.cn: 买一台新电脑要花多少钱？

segments.en: Well, this desktop over here is our latest model.
segments.cn: 嗯，这台桌面电脑是我们最新的型号。

segments.en: It has a 4 gigahertz processor with 16 gigabytes in RAM and a hard disk with 1 terabyte.
segments.cn: 它有一个4千兆赫的处理器，16GB的RAM和1TB的硬盘。

segments.en: Of course, it includes a mouse, keyboard and desk speakers.
segments.cn: 当然，它包括鼠标、键盘和桌面音箱。

segments.en: I have no idea what you are talking about.
segments.cn: 我不知道你在说什么。

segments.en: I just want to know if it's good and if I'll be able to play solitaire without the computer crashing or freezing all the time.
segments.cn: 我只想知道它是否好，以及我是否能在不崩溃或冻结的情况下玩接龙。

segments.en: This PC is top of the line and I guarantee it will never freeze.
segments.cn: 这台电脑是顶级的，我保证它永远不会冻结。

segments.en: If it does, we'll give you your money back.
segments.cn: 如果它冻结，我们会退还你的钱。

segments.en: All right, we're back.
segments.cn: 好的，我们回来了。

segments.en: So computers.
segments.cn: 所以电脑。

segments.en: Catherine, I know you recently got a nice Macintosh.
segments.cn: 凯瑟琳，我知道你最近买了一台不错的Macintosh。

segments.en: Yeah, I did.
segments.cn: 是的，我买了。

segments.en: It's one of those big screen ones, right?
segments.cn: 它是那种大屏幕的，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, it is.
segments.cn: 是的，是的。

segments.en: It's a desktop, so it's not a laptop.
segments.cn: 它是台式机，不是笔记本。

segments.en: And it's got a very fast processor because Macs started using Intel processors a couple of years ago and that made them much faster.
segments.cn: 它有一个非常快的处理器，因为Mac几年前开始使用英特尔处理器，这让它们快了很多。

segments.en: Wow, and this processor actually has two cores, right?
segments.cn: 哇，这个处理器实际上有两个核心，对吧？

segments.en: So basically it has two different brains almost within one processor.
segments.cn: 所以基本上它在一个处理器内有两个不同的“大脑”。

segments.en: Which gives it really bad headaches.
segments.cn: 这让它真的很头疼。

segments.en: She complains to me often.
segments.cn: 她经常向我抱怨。

segments.en: Are you a big Mac fan or PC fan?
segments.cn: 你是大Mac粉还是PC粉？

segments.en: I'm a Mac fan.
segments.cn: 我是Mac粉。

segments.en: I've been converted.
segments.cn: 我已经被转化了。

segments.en: My roommate in college my sophomore year had a Mac and ever since then I've really gotten into them.
segments.cn: 我大学二年级的室友有一台Mac，从那时起我真的开始喜欢它们。

segments.en: So really I went Mac and didn't turn back.
segments.cn: 所以我真的选择了Mac，没有回头。

segments.en: I still honestly cannot really use a Mac.
segments.cn: 我老实说还是不能真正使用Mac。

segments.en: I get confused.
segments.cn: 我感到困惑。

segments.en: I'm looking for this for the start button and I'm looking for where my documents are.
segments.cn: 我在找开始按钮，找我的文档。

segments.en: It's really hard to change over, right?
segments.cn: 真的很难转变，对吧？

segments.en: But once you do, you don't want to change back because everything is so much easier on a Mac.
segments.cn: 但一旦你转变过来，你就不想再换回去，因为在Mac上所有东西都容易得多。

segments.en: Really?
segments.cn: 真的？

segments.en: But if you're really into PC gaming, then you should probably stick with it.
segments.cn: 但如果你真的喜欢PC游戏，那你可能应该坚持使用它。

segments.en: Stick with the PCs because the games just don't really compare on Macs.
segments.cn: 坚持使用PC，因为游戏在Mac上根本无法比较。

segments.en: But I've heard that also Macs don't really suffer from viruses, right?
segments.cn: 但我听说Mac也不容易感染病毒，对吧？

segments.en: No, they don't, which is great because I always used to get these viruses that would float on my computer because you know there's nastiness on your desktop.
segments.cn: 不，它们不会，这很好，因为我总是会在电脑上感染这些病毒，因为你知道桌面上有很多恶心的东西。

segments.en: Well now I don't really have that problem and also there's really wonderful photo editing software and video editing software.
segments.cn: 现在我真的没有这个问题，还有非常好的照片编辑软件和视频编辑软件。

segments.en: So everything is just really easy to find and easy to use.
segments.cn: 所以一切都很容易找到和使用。

segments.en: What about you listeners?
segments.cn: 听众们，你们呢？

segments.en: Do you prefer the Mac?
segments.cn: 你们喜欢Mac吗？

segments.en: Do you prefer the PC or maybe some of our listeners don't really even like computers?
segments.cn: 你们喜欢PC，还是我们的一些听众甚至不喜欢电脑？

segments.en: Well let us know either way.
segments.cn: 好吧，无论如何告诉我们。

segments.en: We're very curious to hear what you have to say and of course writing on our comment section is great practice for your English.
segments.cn: 我们非常好奇听到你们的看法，当然在评论区写作也是练习英语的好方法。

segments.en: Right, so we'll see you guys there and until next time.
segments.cn: 好的，我们下次见。

segments.en: Bye everyone.
segments.cn: 大家再见。

segments.en: Bye.
segments.cn: 再见。
